item.title: Expressing support for emergency first responders and States and local communities, which are on the front lines of the Nation's homeland defense.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1754)

summary.text: Calls for full funding of all traditional first responder programs and appropriate substantial additional resources to assist local communities and first responders in making the Nation's homeland defense as strong as possible.

bill.title: A resolution expressing support for the emergency first responders and communities which are the front lines of the Nation's homeland defense.

item.title: A resolution expressing support for the emergency first responders and communities which are the front lines of the Nation's homeland defense.
A resolution expressing support for the emergency first responders and communities which are the front lines of the Nation's homeland defense.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1754)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
